thread.title: 'The Walking Dead': Wolves at the Door | Love That TV | Television News
thread.title_full: 'The Walking Dead': Wolves at the Door | Love That TV | Television News | Boston Herald

author: Mark Perigard
title: 'The Walking Dead': Wolves at the Door | Love That TV | Television News
text:
Carol (Melissa McBride) is a ninja.
You got your proof on last night’s episode of AMC’s “The Walking Dead.”
In “JSS” – more on those mystery initials later – we jump back in time some hours from the premiere, to life in Alexandria, where the biggest excitement of the day is Carol’s plan to make celery soup.
In the food pantry, the housewives marvel at Carol’s ability to make savory dishes out of fifth-rate ingredients.
“You are an honest-to-goodness hero,” one says.
Foreshadow much, show?
Carol’s domesticity – baking, watching over Judith on a baby monitor – is interrupted by the Wolves, who have somehow breached the walls and are hacking everyone in sight – with a vengeance.
Have we ever seen humans on this show so hyped up, so manical about killing other people? It's terrifying.
As the native Alexandrians prove almost to a one to be unable to defend themselves – even Deanna (Tovah Feldshuh) pretty much decides to sit the fight out – Carol and Morgan (Lennie James) must fight off the marauders.
Problem: They don’t agree on tactics.
Carol believes in leaving no assailants behind; Morgan values life.
Carol sees no choice but to kill.
“Carol, you don’t like it,” Morgan says.
That hits a nerve.
They separate on their way to the armory. Carol knows she has to prevent the Wolves from reaching the guns.
Morgan just has to rescue Father Gabriel . (Me at home: WHY?)
And just when Morgan has the thug tied up nice and starts getting some answers, Carol stops by with a gun and shoots the Wolf dead just as casually as if she were stopping for some firewood.
Morgan is better at convincing some Wolves to leave the compound with his “stick-fu.”
But one manages to take a firearm off a corpse before leaving. Oh, that's going to bite the survivors in the future.
Clearing out one house, Morgan is finally forced to take a life.
Here's the irony for both Morgan and Carol: Both were right about the other.
Carol knew it was either kill or be killed; Morgan knows the act of taking a life scars the soul forever. Both bear the psychic wounds of this raid.
They cross paths on a street strewn with corpses, never acknowledging the other.
So that "lunch bell" that drew the walkers off their path last week? A truck driven by the Wolves crashed into the wall, it’s airhorn blaring.
Denise was a psychotherapist, but the death of the last physician has led to a career change. She’s played by “Nurse Jackie” Emmy winner Merritt Wever and we immediately love her and are desperately scared for her in this insane world. Her attempt to save the life of one bleeding resident goes about as badly as possible.
The initials JSS – “Just Survive Somehow” - a mantra Enid (Katelyn Nacon) relied upon, tracing the letters on a car window, on the ground, on her smudged hand.
It’s a whole teenage angst thing – just like the note and the disappearing act she pulls on Carl.
Kids.
Can’t live with them, can’t leave ‘em out in the woods as walker bait.
